author: whazz
title: Social Mobile Game powered by CNFTs
description: 简单但重要的低挂果实的用例没有被充分利用，以使游戏者接触到生态系统。特别是移动和社交游戏。

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal tries to address the challenge of exposing the gamers to the Cardano ecosystem through mobile games and social games by building a mobile game that exposes gamers to the ecosystem and wants to use Twitter integration for social element and exposure.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has proven experience and has the required skills. The proposal also comes with a detailed plan and timeline which makes the proposal more promising. The proposal also consists of a clear deadline for the launch of the alpha and beta version and has also provided a detailed budget breakdown of 45K that seems reasonable and practical. Based on all this info it is very likely  this proposal will be successfully implemented
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal consists of ample information on the possible KPIs and Definition of success for 3, 6, and 12 months this information will be helpful for auditors to track the progress of the proposal. The proposal also comes with a detailed fund allocation. The provided information is enough to track the progress of the proposal successfully.

f6_assessments.q0:
A very well written proposal and one of the very few that not only provides information by problem statement and solution but also has a separate section on "How it impacts the challenge metrics".

This shows very high level of professionalism and very disciplined approach to addressing the challenge settings in minute details.

Overall, i strongly feel that the proposed game has very good business model (such as game enthusiasm sustained for over 24 hours) of  that will bring a lot of gamers to the system and not only bring them but also make them more involved in post game play times via social networks such as twitter.
f6_assessments.q1:
The experience of the team is very good. The public profiles are accessible to the community and they have a fair share of members who cover most of the dimensions that are required for this proposal's implementation.

It is also visible that team has already decided on the tech stack and has given reasoning behind it. As a developer myself, i can see that they have the implementation roadmap already figured it out and have already started on the game (website link and soundcloud sample of main OST is given).

An overall plan is very well outlined, not only quarterly milestones are given, but the budget allocation to those deliverables is very well explained. 

Therefore, i fully agree that both experience and plan presented make this proposal highly likely to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided here is very well written up. Each quarterly milestone is split further into where the funds will go in a particular milestone. 

A further description section is provided that explains what the goal is and then further required features are given. These feature sets are implementation level details, therefore it makes me glad that the team has already figured out the roadmap not only in abstract sense but also all the way down to the implementation details.

Overall i see no issues in auditing the progress and hence the success of this proposal. Therefore, i am completely satisfied with this proposal writeup. Good luck to the team

f6_assessments.q0:
This game is within the challenge, and the team has explained clearly how their game will impact the Cardano ecosystem in the proposal. Moreover, they have a very detailed key metrics session that is explained how they impact and align to the challenge givens. 
This proposal is fulfilled by a lot of information that shows the game will make a big effect on the development of the ecosystem and gaming communities of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
All the detail inside the proposal can perfectly show the feasibility of this game when publishing. Including the roadmap with detail into a group of activities by quarter, there is some key partners that will work with them in this game also attached, and the key success is also fit and realistic with the timeline... there is solution detail that is explained not just in user cases but also in technology. And surely, the budget is broken down into months and every penny is reasonable for funding. So I think they can beat their goal. 
From my experiences, making games is not easy and we can look at their plan, there are a lot of things to do. So I hope that they can figure out some risks and prepare to get rid of them
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal is completely auditable, more than that their provided info can help us audit the project in every detail in many ways, including the clear key metrics, their goals, and event the detail in the implementation plan can help to audit the single task of the team. 
About the solution explanation, they describe very detail their game including vision, value proposition, use case... this is absolutely clear enough for getting what they want to make.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very interesting proposition, it builds as a social CNFTs game, displays CNFTs in a public forum, demonstrating art and utility capabilities. Provide Cardano and CNFT community visibility to the mainstream gamer.
This project should directly impact the following challenge metrics. This project would add a new mobile game to the ecosystem. Some of the CNFTs from the project will be created specifically for the game and increase this value.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has a lot of potential and a lot of experience. Each person undertakes a different job, creating important links that make the job easier.
I went through your work plan and website, they are very detailed. The budget allocation for each stage is very reasonable, making it possible for everyone to see how the money will be used.
f6_assessments.q2:
I am someone who has worked at several game companies. I think I have experience in this field, I have a suggestion for you. The information you provide is quite clear and complete, however, you should clarify more about the Play-To-Earn aspect of the game.
I hope this project gets underway, I really enjoyed it.
